title: World Book Day costumes: a parent's 7 stages of crisis
text:
World Book Day costumes: a parent's 7 stages of crisis "...and first prize goes to Cindy, who came dressed as the First Minister of Scotland..." Credit: PA 21 February 2017 • 4:05pm 
A round the world, a wonderful thing is happening: children are getting excited about reading and literature. For their parents, however, this comes with a slight challenge: what to dress them in for 2017 World Book Day on March 2nd? 
Every year people combine their children's imagination with the realms of practicality, and that's before tackling whatever theme the school has decided upon that year and playground competition. 
What happens in times like this? Naturally, people take to social media to chart their literary character trials, tribulations and triumphs. Introducing the seven stages of World Book Day costuming: 1. Discovering World Book Day is approaching 
Only the remarkably organised actually remember when World Book Day is, let alone plan for it. For everyone else, it's discovering the reminder letter in the bottom of their child's book bag: World book day tomorrow, not only do I have a child to sort a costume for but also a husband who is highly disorganised! — hunkydory home (@hunkydoryhome) March 4, 2015 URGENT. — Seán Delaney (@seanjdelaney) March 3, 2015 On the train back to Manchester to begin my annual World Book Day late night costume panic ... — Lucy Powell MP (@LucyMPowell) March 2, 2016 So glad I no longer have that panic feeling trying to find an outfit for the kids on the day before World Book Day #WBD16 — Kara Partington (@KaraParty) March 2, 2016 2. Establishing your child's favourite literary character 
F irst comes the decision making: Got G to decide on a world book day costume.. Cat in the Hat.. I can pull this off with her party only a week away.. #KeepTellingMyselfThat — LouLou (@LouLouBellaElla) February 21, 2017 
Then comes the slight hitch of dealing with artistic license: For world book day tomorrow, Son has decided to go as Danny the champion of the world. Bloody pheasants. pic.twitter.com/rsPSscO4iV
